channel.description: YouTube Video Resources Slides Video Script Next, let’s review another key concept from object-oriented programming: state and behavior. The state of a computer program refers to the instantaneous values of all of the variables present in the program at any given time during the program’s execution. So, in this simple diagram, we would say that the program’s state is the current value of the three variables: temp = 30, moisture = 95, and nutrients = 75.
